title: Safe Mayapple Fruit Identification
brief: Identify and safely consume ripe mayapple fruit while avoiding poisonous parts.
steps: Step 1: Locate mayapple plants - they have large, umbrella-like leaves.
Step 2: Only harvest fully ripe fruit that has turned yellow or yellowish-green.
Step 3: Avoid all green (unripe) fruit - these are poisonous.
Step 4: Do not consume any other parts of the plant (leaves, stems, roots) - all are toxic.
Step 5: Eat only the ripe fruit flesh, avoiding seeds if possible.
warnings: All parts of mayapple except ripe fruit are poisonous.
Green (unripe) fruit is toxic and can cause severe illness.
Never consume leaves, stems, or roots of mayapple.
